title: How to Optimize Your Routes and Save Drive Time
description: Cut fuel costs and fit more jobs per day with smarter route planning.
requirements: Your list of jobs for the day or week
Home or office address as starting point

steps.title: Use Google Maps for simple route planning
steps.description: For 2-3 stops, Google Maps handles it well.
substeps: Open Google Maps
Enter your first destination
Tap the three dots â†’ 'Add stop'
Add up to 9 additional stops
Google automatically optimizes the order
steps.tip: Drag stops to manually reorder if you have time constraints.

steps.title: Try a free route optimizer for more stops
steps.description: When you have 5+ stops, specialized tools work better.
substeps: Free options: Circuit (free tier), RouteXL (free for 20 stops)
Go to routexl.com
Import your addresses (copy-paste or upload)
Click 'Find Route' and it optimizes the order
Export to Google Maps for turn-by-turn navigation

steps.title: Group jobs by area
steps.description: The easiest optimization is geographic clustering.
substeps: When scheduling, ask: 'What else is near this job?'
Try to book same-area jobs on the same day
Label jobs by zone in your calendar/CRM
Mondays: North side, Tuesdays: South side, etc.
steps.tip: Even rough geographic grouping can cut drive time by 20-30%.

steps.title: Consider traffic patterns
steps.description: When you drive matters as much as where.
substeps: Schedule far jobs for early morning (before rush hour)
Midday: Focus on the area you're already in
Avoid crossing town during rush hour (7-9am, 4-6pm)
Google Maps' 'Depart at' feature shows predicted traffic

steps.title: Review and improve weekly
steps.description: Learn from what worked and what didn't.
substeps: Friday: Look at how much you drove this week
Could any jobs have been grouped better?
Track: Jobs per day, total miles driven
Goal: More jobs per day with fewer miles

successMessage: You're now planning smarter routes! Less driving means more jobs and lower costs.
proTips: Your vehicle cost is roughly $0.50-0.70/mile. 20 fewer miles/day = $3,000+/year saved
Tell customers you can offer a discount if they're flexible on timing and near other jobs
If you hire helpers, route optimization becomes even more valuable
